newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Earthquake hits southwestern Macedonia - agency.
newsitem.headline: Earthquake hits southwestern Macedonia - agency.

text.p: The seismological observatory in Macedonia's capital Skopje registered an earthquake measuring 3.6 degrees on the Richter scale on Sunday, independent Belgrade news agency Beta reported.
The epicentre of the quake, which occurred at around 0300 GMT, was some 130 km (70 miles) southwest of Skopje on the territory of Albania, the report said.
The tremor was felt in the entire southwestern region of Macedonia and gave people a fright in the towns of Ohrid and Struga on lake Ohrid and Resen near the Prespa lake.
An earthquake measuring from 4.8 to 5.5 on the open-ended Richter scale hit Albania, Macedonia and northern Greece on Friday morning but no casualties or major damage were reported.
